Definition: Risks originating from the external business environment beyond organizational control
Key Dimensions: Market dynamics, regulatory environment, stakeholder perception, macroeconomic conditions
Operational Indicators: Comparative disadvantage, compliance violations, reputation damage, market volatility impact

Definition: Risks arising from inadequate or failed internal processes, systems, or human factors
Key Dimensions: Service delivery, process efficiency, technology infrastructure, human capital
Operational Indicators: Service quality degradation, process failures, system disruptions, staff competency gaps

Definition: Risks associated with monetary transactions, pricing strategies, and value perception
Key Dimensions: Pricing structure, payment processing, fee transparency, value proposition
Operational Indicators: Price competitiveness issues, transaction errors, undisclosed charges, perceived value misalignment

Definition: Risks related to long-term strategic positioning and competitive sustainability
Key Dimensions: Product-market alignment, capability gaps, competitive positioning, customer lifecycle
Operational Indicators: Market fit issues, feature inadequacy, strategic disadvantage, retention challenges
